definition: a metallic vessel usually used for boiling liquids, teakettle
a steep-sided hollow without surface drainage especially in a deposit of glacial drift
a usually large group of raptors (such as hawks or vultures) circling high in the sky on an updraft of warm air
examples: … more than 500 birds have been seen riding the same spiraling thermal air current, or "kettle," as they are known to hawk-watchers.

definition: to corral or contain (people) in large numbers by surrounding and forcing into an enclosed area
examples: Police officers stood in a line in front of them but protesters seemed to think they'd be allowed through. They were not. Instead, they were kettled with orange nets, and arrested.
